turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Hey! Do you have a pen and paper handy?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Yes I do. What do you need?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I'm heading back to the office. I want a coffee and I don't want to wait for it.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: You want me to order it for you for pickup?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: That I do. Pickup from the drive thru if possible. I'm i a hurry and I'd rather not have to park.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Pickup from the drive thru then. I'll see what I can do.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I know you will. Are you ready to to copy this down?

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Yes, sir. Whenever you are.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: I want a large Americano, double cupped, with two fingers at the top for cream.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Large Americano with room for cream right?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: No. Not room. The width of two fingers worth of room.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Two fingers?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Yes. Adult sized human fingers. And that measurement is from the top of the cup.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Oh.. I understand what you're saying. Will they though. Where did you want to pick it up from?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: The Starbucks off of Sydney Marcus in the Home Depot Shopping center.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: Got it. Did you want anything else?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: Yeah. Add a small cup of heavy cream. I think we're out at the office.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: You've got it. Large Americano with room. Two fingers worth. One small cup heavy cream. Is that right?

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: That's perfect. Thanks so much.

turns.speaker: cashier
turns.text: You're welcome. See you in a little bit.

turns.speaker: client
turns.text: See you then. Bye.
